attributes.action: Cap the amount that under 25's are charged for car insurance
attributes.additional_details:
Under 25, particularly those who have just started to drive, don't normally have the money to pay for the through the roof insurance prices.

Driving lessons and the test alone cost a lot of money, the government need to cap the amount that  younger people get charged for car insurance. Or work out a system that stops insurances companies taking the mick.

I was once quoted £8,000 for one years insurance on a small, old fiesta. This is out of line because the insurance companies are taking advantage.

Young drivers aren't as irresponsible as people sterotype them to be, there are just a few people who ruin it for the rest. There are poor drivers of all ages not just young.
